content: I've been experimenting with intentional camera movement and creating a sense of blur and motion in my images, especially after attending that photography workshop at the local community center. I tried out a new technique involving intentional camera movement to create a sense of blur and motion in a shot of a beautiful sunset I captured on my evening walk around the neighborhood. It was a bit hit-or-miss, but I liked the outcome. Do you have any tips on how to improve my panning skills, especially when tracking fast-moving subjects like cars or cyclists?
